description: Forum of Incident Response and Security Teams (FIRST) providing incident response resources, CVSS scoring, and CSIRT services. COMPLETELY FREE access to incident response frameworks, best practices, and vulnerability scoring.

bash.check_resources:
#!/bin/bash
# FIRST.org Resources Check - FREE!

echo "🌐 FIRST.org Resources (FREE!)"
echo "================================"
echo "Date: $(date)"
echo ""

# FIRST Resources
echo "📚 Available Resources:"
echo "   • CVSS Calculator: https://www.first.org/cvss/calculator/"
echo "   • CSIRT Framework: https://www.first.org/standards/frameworks/csirts/"
echo "   • PSIRT Framework: https://www.first.org/standards/frameworks/psirts/"
echo "   • TLP Protocol: https://www.first.org/tlp/"
echo "   • IEP Framework: https://www.first.org/iep/"
echo ""

# CVSS Information
echo "🔢 CVSS Scoring:"
echo "   Severity Levels:"
echo "      • 0.0: None"
echo "      • 0.1-3.9: Low"
echo "      • 4.0-6.9: Medium"
echo "      • 7.0-8.9: High"
echo "      • 9.0-10.0: Critical"
echo ""

# TLP Levels
echo "🚦 Traffic Light Protocol:"
echo "   🔴 TLP:RED - Eyes only"
echo "   🟠 TLP:AMBER - Limited sharing"
echo "   🟢 TLP:GREEN - Community only"
echo "   ⚪ TLP:WHITE - Public"
echo ""

# Incident Response Phases
echo "🚨 Incident Response Phases:"
echo "   1. Preparation"
echo "   2. Detection & Analysis"
echo "   3. Containment"
echo "   4. Eradication"
echo "   5. Recovery"
echo "   6. Lessons Learned"
echo ""

echo "📅 Generated: $(date)"

curl.check_cvss:
# Check CVSS calculator page - FREE!
curl -s https://www.first.org/cvss/ | grep -o 'CVSS v[0-9]\.[0-9]' | head -5

python.cvss_calculator:
import json
from datetime import datetime
import math

class FIRSTResourcesAnalyzer:
    """FIRST.org Resources and CVSS Calculator - COMPLETELY FREE!"""
    
    def __init__(self):
        self.base_url = 'https://www.first.org'
        self.cvss_url = f'{self.base_url}/cvss/'
        
        # CVSS v3.1 Base Metrics
        self.cvss_metrics = {
            'AV': {'N': 0.85, 'A': 0.62, 'L': 0.55, 'P': 0.2},  # Attack Vector
            'AC': {'L': 0.77, 'H': 0.44},  # Attack Complexity
            'PR': {  # Privileges Required
                'N': {'unchanged': 0.85, 'changed': 0.85},
                'L': {'unchanged': 0.62, 'changed': 0.68},
                'H': {'unchanged': 0.27, 'changed': 0.5}
            },
            'UI': {'N': 0.85, 'R': 0.62},  # User Interaction
            'S': {'U': 'unchanged', 'C': 'changed'},  # Scope
            'C': {'H': 0.56, 'L': 0.22, 'N': 0},  # Confidentiality
            'I': {'H': 0.56, 'L': 0.22, 'N': 0},  # Integrity
            'A': {'H': 0.56, 'L': 0.22, 'N': 0}   # Availability
        }
    
    def calculate_cvss_score(self, av='N', ac='L', pr='N', ui='N', s='U', c='H', i='H', a='H'):
        """Calculate CVSS v3.1 Base Score"""
        print("🔢 CVSS v3.1 Calculator (FREE!)\n")
        
        # Determine scope
        scope = self.cvss_metrics['S'][s]
        
        # Calculate Impact Sub Score (ISS)
        iss_base = 1 - ((1 - self.cvss_metrics['C'][c]) * 
                        (1 - self.cvss_metrics['I'][i]) * 
                        (1 - self.cvss_metrics['A'][a]))
        
        if scope == 'unchanged':
            impact = 6.42 * iss_base
        else:
            impact = 7.52 * (iss_base - 0.029) - 3.25 * pow(iss_base - 0.02, 15)
        
        # Calculate Exploitability
        exploitability = 8.22 * self.cvss_metrics['AV'][av] * \
                        self.cvss_metrics['AC'][ac] * \
                        self.cvss_metrics['PR'][pr][scope] * \
                        self.cvss_metrics['UI'][ui]
        
        # Calculate Base Score
        if impact <= 0:
            base_score = 0
        elif scope == 'unchanged':
            base_score = min(impact + exploitability, 10)
        else:
            base_score = min(1.08 * (impact + exploitability), 10)
        
        # Round to one decimal place
        base_score = round(base_score, 1)
        
        # Determine severity
        if base_score == 0:
            severity = 'None'
        elif base_score < 4:
            severity = 'Low'
        elif base_score < 7:
            severity = 'Medium'
        elif base_score < 9:
            severity = 'High'
        else:
            severity = 'Critical'
        
        print(f"📊 CVSS Base Score: {base_score}")
        print(f"⚠️ Severity: {severity}\n")
        
        print("Vector String Components:")
        print(f"  AV:{av} - Attack Vector")
        print(f"  AC:{ac} - Attack Complexity")
        print(f"  PR:{pr} - Privileges Required")
        print(f"  UI:{ui} - User Interaction")
        print(f"  S:{s} - Scope")
        print(f"  C:{c} - Confidentiality Impact")
        print(f"  I:{i} - Integrity Impact")
        print(f"  A:{a} - Availability Impact")
        
        vector = f"CVSS:3.1/AV:{av}/AC:{ac}/PR:{pr}/UI:{ui}/S:{s}/C:{c}/I:{i}/A:{a}"
        print(f"\n🔗 Vector String: {vector}")
        
        return base_score, severity, vector
    
    def get_incident_response_framework(self):
        """Get FIRST incident response framework information"""
        print("🚨 FIRST Incident Response Framework (FREE!)\n")
        
        print("📋 CSIRT Services Framework:")
        services = [
            "Incident Management",
            "Vulnerability Management",
            "Artifact Analysis",
            "Security Event Management",
            "Situational Awareness",
            "Knowledge Transfer"
        ]
        
        for service in services:
            print(f"   • {service}")
        
        print("\n🏢 PSIRT Services Framework:")
        psirt_services = [
            "Vulnerability Discovery",
            "Vulnerability Report Intake",
            "Stakeholder Ecosystem Management",
            "Vulnerability Disclosure",
            "Vulnerability Training & Education",
            "Product Security Incident Response"
        ]
        
        for service in psirt_services:
            print(f"   • {service}")
        
        print("\n🚦 Traffic Light Protocol (TLP):")
        tlp_levels = {
            "TLP:RED": "🔴 Not for disclosure, restricted to participants only",
            "TLP:AMBER": "🟠 Limited disclosure, restricted to participants' organizations",
            "TLP:GREEN": "🟢 Limited disclosure, restricted to the community",
            "TLP:WHITE": "⚪ Disclosure is not limited"
        }
        
        for level, description in tlp_levels.items():
            print(f"   {level}: {description}")
        
        return services, psirt_services, tlp_levels
    
    def incident_response_checklist(self):
        """Generate incident response checklist"""
        print("✅ Incident Response Checklist (FREE!)\n")
        
        phases = {
            "1. Preparation": [
                "Establish incident response team",
                "Define incident response procedures",
                "Set up monitoring and detection tools",
                "Create communication plans",
                "Prepare incident tracking system"
            ],
            "2. Detection & Analysis": [
                "Monitor security events",
                "Analyze alerts and indicators",
                "Determine incident scope",
                "Classify incident severity",
                "Document initial findings"
            ],
            "3. Containment": [
                "Isolate affected systems",
                "Preserve evidence",
                "Implement temporary fixes",
                "Monitor for spread",
                "Update security controls"
            ],
            "4. Eradication": [
                "Remove malware/threats",
                "Patch vulnerabilities",
                "Update security measures",
                "Verify threat removal",
                "Strengthen defenses"
            ],
            "5. Recovery": [
                "Restore systems to production",
                "Monitor for reinfection",
                "Verify system integrity",
                "Test functionality",
                "Document recovery steps"
            ],
            "6. Lessons Learned": [
                "Conduct post-incident review",
                "Document improvements",
                "Update response procedures",
                "Share threat intelligence",
                "Train team on findings"
            ]
        }
        
        for phase, tasks in phases.items():
            print(f"📌 {phase}:")
            for task in tasks:
                print(f"   [ ] {task}")
            print()
        
        return phases
    
    def generate_report(self):
        """Generate comprehensive FIRST resources report"""
        print(f"🌐 FIRST.org Resources Report (FREE!)")
        print(f"Report Date: {datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}\n")
        
        print("=" * 50)
        print("🔢 CVSS SCORING EXAMPLE")
        print("=" * 50)
        # Example: Critical vulnerability
        self.calculate_cvss_score(av='N', ac='L', pr='N', ui='N', s='C', c='H', i='H', a='H')
        
        print("\n" + "=" * 50)
        print("🚨 INCIDENT RESPONSE FRAMEWORK")
        print("=" * 50)
        self.get_incident_response_framework()
        
        print("\n" + "=" * 50)
        print("✅ RESPONSE CHECKLIST")
        print("=" * 50)
        self.incident_response_checklist()
        
        print("\n" + "=" * 50)
        print("🔗 RESOURCES")
        print("=" * 50)
        
        print("\n📚 Key Resources:")
        print(f"   • CVSS Calculator: {self.cvss_url}calculator/")
        print(f"   • CSIRT Framework: {self.base_url}/standards/frameworks/csirts/")
        print(f"   • PSIRT Framework: {self.base_url}/standards/frameworks/psirts/")
        print(f"   • TLP Protocol: {self.base_url}/tlp/")
        print(f"   • Best Practices: {self.base_url}/resources/guides/")
        
        print("\n💡 Recommendations:")
        print("   1. Use CVSS for consistent vulnerability scoring")
        print("   2. Implement CSIRT/PSIRT frameworks")
        print("   3. Adopt TLP for information sharing")
        print("   4. Follow incident response best practices")
        print("   5. Participate in FIRST community")
        
        return True

# Usage
analyzer = FIRSTResourcesAnalyzer()
analyzer.generate_report()
